NEWS.title: Bob Geldof, Midge Ure, & Brian May Reunite For Live Aid’s 40th Anniversary
NEWS.summary: Forty years after the historic Live Aid concerts that featured iconic performances by the likes of Led Zeppelin, Black Sabbath, and Queen, Live Aid founders Bob Geldof and Midge Ure reunited with Queen guitarist Brian May to commemorate the 40th anniversary of the event, which raised funds for famine relief in Ethiopia and featured a star-studded lineup that included Teddy Pendergrass making his first public appearance after a debilitating car accident and Phil Collins famously jumping on the Concorde to perform at both the London and Philadelphia shows, with U2's set considered a breakthrough moment in their rise to global superstardom....
